titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Student Religious Organizations records CA.MS.00307
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Anne Lozier.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-11-15 09:24:01 -0500.

change.item: This resource was modified by the ArchivesSpace Preprocessor developed by the Harvard Library (https://github.com/harvard-library/archivesspace-preprocessor)
Updated to conform to DACS and added boxes

did.abstract: Contains minutes, correspondence, memos, photographs, printed material and general material related to student religious organizations at Smith College.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records of the Student Religious Organizations were donated over a period of time to the Smith College Archives from a variety of sources.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into four series:

list.item: Series II. Smith College Association for Christian Work (SCACW), 1892-1977
Series III. Smith College Religious Association (SCRA), 1941-1977

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Smith College Association for Christian Work (SCACW) was founded in 1892. It was designed, according to its constitution, "to promote the development of a broad and intelligent activity in the cause of humanity and to unite in one central body the organizations already existing in the college and those to be formed in future for the purpose of active Christian work." By 1953, the organization is identified as the Smith College Religious Association (SCRA), and is referred to as an 'interfaith' organization. Today this area of student life is referred to as Religious and Spiritual Life, and encompasses many different faiths and worshipping communities.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Student Religious Organizations records, Box #, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-00307, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These records consist primarily of records of the Smith College Association for Christian Work and the Smith College Religious Association, the two largest identities of the religious organizations of Smith College's history. Types of materials include chapel correspondence, information on retreats and conferences, activities and services, committee minutes, press releases, announcements, reports, financial information, and photographs. The most recent records reflect the growing diversity of the college community and its varying faiths.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.
